outline:
1. to go, go or rove about, go to and fro
    1. (Qal) to go or rove about
    2. (Polel) to go to and fro, go eagerly or quickly to and fro
    3. (Hithpolel) to run to and fro
  2. to row
kjv_def: go (about, through, to and fro), mariner, rower, run to and fro.
strongs_def: properly, to push forth; (but used only figuratively) to lash, i.e. (the sea with oars) to row; by implication, to travel
